rename.from: Unable to load entities after upgrade to version 0.3.12
rename.to: Unable to load entities after update to version 0.3.12

body:
I've encountered this bug as well. I debugged into TypeORM and figured out that it was caused by the update of package [glob](https://github.com/isaacs/node-glob), which is responsible for resolving the glob pattern used in the entity configuration.  
As mentioned in [this issue](https://github.com/isaacs/node-glob/issues/480), the update breaks its compatibility on Windows, interpreting "\\" as an escape character instead of a valid path separator.  
This is the origin of this bug, but another point also contributes to this problem: TypeORM will normalize the path before passing it to glob ([util/DirectoryExportedClassesLoader](https://github.com/typeorm/typeorm/blob/master/src/util/DirectoryExportedClassesLoader.ts#L76)), which will replace all forward slashes with backslashes (because backslash is the primary path separator on Windows). That's why this bug will still occur even if you use forward slashes in your config file.

issue.title: Use forward slashes when normalizing path on Windows

repository.name: typeorm
repository.description: ORM for TypeScript and JavaScript. Supports MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, SQLite, MS SQL Server, Oracle, SAP Hana, WebSQL databases. Works in NodeJS, Browser, Ionic, Cordova and Electron platforms.

issue.body:
Fixes #9766

### Description of change
Replace backslashes with forward slashes when normalizing a path on Windows, in order to make the path work for glob pattern resolving.

body:
Some temporary solutions before a new patch version release:
- Downgrade to 0.3.11
- Manually import all entity classes and list them in the config file
Thanks @truemogician for investigation and detailed explanation.

issue.title: Cannot show any migrations using cli

repository.name: typeorm
repository.description: ORM for TypeScript and JavaScript. Supports MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, SQLite, MS SQL Server, Oracle, SAP Hana, WebSQL databases. Works in NodeJS, Browser, Ionic, Cordova and Electron platforms.

issue.body:
### Issue description

yarn typeorm migration:show -d ./src/data-sources.ts won't show anything

### Expected Behavior

It should show me a list of migrations

### Actual Behavior

doesn't show me any of the migrations i have generated

### Steps to reproduce

From empty folder.. follow the instructions in the quickstart guide.. Except I used mysql and yarn.

Run `yarn typeorm migration:generate -d .\src\data-source.ts init`
move the created migration file to migration folder

change data-source to following.

```
import "reflect-metadata"
import { DataSource } from "typeorm"
import { User } from "./entity/User"

export const AppDataSource = new DataSource({
    type: "mysql",
    host: "localhost",
    port: 3306,
    username: "test",
    password: "test",
    database: "test",
    synchronize: true,
    logging: false,
    entities: [User],
    migrations: [join(__dirname, 'migration/*{.ts,.js}')],
    subscribers: [],
})
```
Then run migration:show `yarn typeorm migration:show -d .\src\data-source.ts `

It shows nothing.. 


### My Environment

| Dependency          | Version  |
| ---                 | ---      |
| Operating System    |   Windows 11  |
| Node.js version     | 16.18.0  |
| Typescript version  | 4.5.2  |
| TypeORM version     | 0.3.12 |

Also.. my mysql environment is on aws using aurora-mysql

### Additional Context

_No response_

### Are you willing to resolve this issue by submitting a Pull Request?

No, I donâ€™t have the time and Iâ€™m okay to wait for the community / maintainers to resolve this issue.

issue.body:
### Issue description

When we give paths for new migrations in DataSource migration array and run migration using windows CLI, it return response `No migration pending`

### Expected Behavior

when I give migration as 
```
migrations: ['./dist/migrations/*.js']
```
Ideal behavior while running migration, It should read new migrations files and do the action accordingly.

### Actual Behavior

When I run migration via windows CLI it returns response `No migration are pending`

### Steps to reproduce

Inside DataSource pass migration value as: -
```
migrations: ['./dist/migrations/*.js']
```

run command:-
```
npm run typeorm migration:run -- -d /path-to-data.source.ts```
```

package.json script:-
```json
"typeorm": "npx typeorm-ts-node-commonjs"
```


### My Environment

| Dependency          | Version  |

issue.title: { EntityMetadataNotFound: No metadata for "User" was found.

repository.name: typeorm
repository.description: ORM for TypeScript and JavaScript. Supports MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, SQLite, MS SQL Server, Oracle, SAP Hana, WebSQL databases. Works in NodeJS, Browser, Ionic, Cordova and Electron platforms.

issue.body:
Hello,
I'm trying to setup a new project using the latest release and the ormconfig.yml options.

I'm following the documentation and pointing it to the `src/entity/*.js` location, but i keep getting the following error when running my server.spec.ts file through mocha:

```
{ EntityMetadataNotFound: No metadata for "User" was found.
    at EntityMetadataNotFound.Error (native)
    at new EntityMetadataNotFound (/Users/paco/projects/mezcal/server/src/error/EntityMetadataNotFound.ts:7:9)
    at Connection.getMetadata (/Users/paco/projects/mezcal/server/src/connection/Connection.ts:297:19)
    at EntityManager.<anonymous> (/Users/paco/projects/mezcal/server/src/entity-manager/EntityManager.ts:310:54)
    at step (/Users/paco/projects/mezcal/server/node_modules/typeorm/entity-manager/EntityManager.js:32:23)
    at Object.next (/Users/paco/projects/mezcal/server/node_modules/typeorm/entity-manager/EntityManager.js:13:53)
    at /Users/paco/projects/mezcal/server/node_modules/typeorm/entity-manager/EntityManager.js:7:71
    at __awaiter (/Users/paco/projects/mezcal/server/node_modules/typeorm/entity-manager/EntityManager.js:3:12)
    at /Users/paco/projects/mezcal/server/src/entity-manager/EntityManager.ts:280:39
  name: 'EntityMetadataNotFound',
  message: 'No metadata for "User" was found.' }
```

I've posted a sample repo here:
https://github.com/rightisleft/public-error
https://github.com/rightisleft/public-error/blob/master/server/test/server.spec.ts#L29

I've been reading the documentation at https://github.com/typeorm/typeorm/issues/420 but have been unable to resolve the problem.

Please advise. 

**Checklist:**
Using reflect-metadata in spec
Using "emitDecoratorMetadata": true, "experimentalDecorators": true in tsconfig.json
Using 'entries' delcaration in ormconfig.yml

issue.title: Dependency on typeorm v0.3.12 causing EntityMetaDataNotFound error in Windows

repository.name: nestjs-paginate
repository.description: Pagination and filtering helper method for TypeORM repositories or query builders using Nest.js framework :book::paperclip:

issue.body:
The package dependency on `typeorm@0.3.12` is causing me to get the following error on Windows: `EntityMetadataNotFoundError: No metadata for "User" was found.`

updating from `v4.2.2` to `v5.0.0` introduced this error as it incremented my version of `typeorm` in `package-lock.json` from `v0.3.10` to `v.0.3.12` to introduce this error exclusively on Windows. I validated by updating the version of `typeorm` (and not `nestjs-paginate` and saw it on WIndows slice, but not MacOS.

Other users have reported similar problems with `typeorm@0.3.12`: 
https://github.com/typeorm/typeorm/issues/9860
https://github.com/typeorm/typeorm/issues/9766

Downgrading to `v0.3.11` eliminates this issue. There is also a merged commit for a potential fix, but this has not been released as a patch version yet: https://github.com/typeorm/typeorm/pull/9768

issue.title: Migration generate and run breaking after upgrading to 0.3.12

repository.name: typeorm
repository.description: ORM for TypeScript and JavaScript. Supports MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, SQLite, MS SQL Server, Oracle, SAP Hana, WebSQL databases. Works in NodeJS, Browser, Ionic, Cordova and Electron platforms.

issue.body:
### Issue description

migration:run and migration:generate are not working in 0.3.12

### Expected Behavior

Migration should run.

### Actual Behavior

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/71782108/229479309-48a11107-8071-42c9-b300-4018d550ffec.png)

Typeorm, Could not delete the new changes and generate the migration.

Also, It can't detect the existing migration with migration:run command.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Upgrade to typeorm version 0.3.12
2. Do some changes in the entities or create new entity.
3. Run the migration:run or migration:generate

### My Environment

| Dependency          | Version  |
| ---                 | ---      |
| Operating System    |          |
| Node.js version     | x.y.zzz  |
| Typescript version  | x.y.zzz  |
| TypeORM version     | x.y.zzz  |
